1423360837092319232.text: (9/10) I will continue to push for resources, including hazard pay, to relieve our overwhelmed U.S. Customs & Border Protection agents & local health care providers. I remain at the service of those in the #TX15 & will do all I can in my power to resolve this situation.

1423360836106653700.text: (8/10) I understand the frustrations of my community, & I, too, am tired of our region being overlooked & politicized by administrations past & present. The help we have received from the federal government has been wholly insufficient & the Biden admin must do more quickly.

1423360835263639558.text: (7/10) My staff and I are monitoring the situation on the ground and are providing support wherever able.

1423360834374340614.text: (6/10) I am in contact with local officials, @DHSgov and the @WhiteHouse on the ongoing developments and am committed to a long-term legislative solution to address the root causes of migration and relief for South Texans.

1423360833371967489.text: (5/10) I am focused on solutions that will help our community and demanding the federal government take more responsibility instead of relying on state and local governments to provide support for our hospitals and non-profits.

1423360832356995075.text: (4/10) In recent days, I have met with the @SpeakerPelosi & @DHSgov @SecMayorkas & discussed the urgent need for immediate engagement & assistance to improve the situation in South Texas & my proposal to establish in-country asylum processing.

1423360831564259328.text: (3/10) The entire situation and the federal response is unacceptable.

1423360830603763712.text: (2/10) The Biden administration lacks a clear and defined process for the testing of migrants and continues to depend on third-party partners for a job it should be doing. Hospitals are also responding to a state and nationwide spike in COVID-19 cases and patients.

1423360829655855104.text: (1/10) I continue to demand answers and resources from the Biden administration in regards to the influx of migrants at our border and their release into our community.

1252245584095961088.text: The employees of @USPS are essential and continue to deliver packages to our doorsteps during this time of crisis. Every employee of the USPS are front-line workers and I urge @DonaldTrump, @SpeakerPelosi, & @senatemajldr  for bipartisan funding to keep the @USPS afloat. (7/8)

1252245583290683393.text: Not only do millions of Americans rely on the @USPS to deliver checks, mail, and live-saving prescriptions, the 2020 election & #Census are just around the corner. It is crucial to have a fully functional USPS to ensure an accurate count and the integrity of our democracy. (6/8)

1252245582439223299.text: .@USPS employs more than 650,000 people and they connect 160 million households and businesses. Unlike private companies, USPS is MANDATED to deliver mail at equal rates to anywhere in the country, including rural communities which are not necessarily profitable. (5/8)

1252245581596164101.text: The $2T #CARES Act provided a $10Br loan for @USPS, far short of what USPS needs to stay financially solvent during the #COVID19 pandemic. The bipartisan Postal Service Board unanimously voted to ask Congress for $89B to save this critical government agency. (4/8)

1252245580774023168.text: It’s absurd that ONLY the Post Office has a pre-funding mandate as burdensome as this. No private corporation or other federal agency is required to do this and this mandate accounts for the majority of @USPS’ losses. (3/8)

1252245579901685760.text: The Post Office has been self-funded since the 1980s, however in 2006, Congress passed The Postal Accountability and Enhancement Act, which required @USPS to create a $72 billion fund to pay for the cost of its post-retirement health care costs ... 75 years into the future. (2/8)

1252245579054399488.text: Postmaster General Megan Brennan told lawmakers that @USPS is projected to lose $13 billion due to #COVID19 and an additional $54 billion over the next decade. USPS projects that it could run out of money by September if they do not obtain more funding. (1/8)

1034175297984376832.text: I look forward to reviewing the details of this preliminary agreement and to working with Mexican President Peña Nieto @EPN, incoming Mexican President Lopez Obrador @lopezobrador_, and Canadian Prime Minister @JustinTrudeau to reach a final agreement with our partners in Canada.
